A payment is a financial transaction in which a sum of money is transferred from one party to another in exchange for goods, services, or to fulfill a financial obligation. The sender of the payment is typically known as the payer, while the recipient is known as the payee.There are many different types of payments that can be made, but they all have one thing in common: they all involve the exchange of money. The most common type of payment is a direct exchange, where one party pays another party directly for goods or services. This type of payment is often made between businesses, but can also be made between individuals.Another common type of payment is an indirect exchange, where one party pays another party indirectly for goods or services. This type of payment is often made between individuals, but can also be made between businesses. Indirect payments are usually made through a third party, such as a bank or a credit card company.Finally, there are also payments that are made to fulfill a financial obligation. These types of payments are typically made by businesses to their creditors, but can also be made by individuals. The most common type of payment made to fulfill a financial obligation is a loan payment.No matter what type of payment is being made, there are usually three parties involved: the payer, the payee, and a financial institution. The payer is the party who is sending the payment, the payee is the party who is receiving the payment, and the financial institution is the party that is facilitating the transaction.There are many different ways to make a payment, but the most common method is by using cash. Cash is the most widely accepted form of payment, and can be used to make payments in person, by mail, or online. Other common methods of payment include checks, money orders, credit cards, and debit cards.When making a payment, it is important to make sure that all of the necessary information is included. The payer and payee should agree on the amount of the payment, the date of the payment, and the method of payment. Once all of the information has been agreed upon, the payer can make the payment.If you are the payer, there are a few things you should do to make sure that your payment is processed smoothly. First, you should make sure that you have the correct amount of money. Second, you should make sure that the payee's name and address are correct. Finally, you should make sure that the payment method you are using is accepted by the payee.If you are the payee, there are a few things you should do to make sure that you receive your payment. First, you should make sure that you have provided the payer with your name and address. Second, you should make sure that you have provided the payer with the correct amount of money. Finally, you should make sure that you have provided the payer with the correct payment method.Once the payment has been made, the payer and payee should both keep a copy of the receipt. The receipt should include the payer's name and address, the payee's name and address, the amount of the payment, the date of the payment, and the method of payment. The receipt will serve as proof that the payment was made, and will be helpful if there are any questions or problems with the payment.

Patients are those who are sick or injured and in need of medical care. They are the ones who visit doctors, and they are the focus of the medical profession.Medical care is not just about treating the sick; it is also about preventing illness and injury, and promoting health. It is an important part of our society, and it plays a vital role in our economy.The word "patient" comes from the Latin word for "suffering." A patient is someone who is enduring an illness or injury. Doctors and other medical professionals are dedicated to relieving the suffering of their patients.Patients have certain rights, which include the right to receive information about their condition, the right to make decisions about their care, and the right to privacy.Doctors have a duty to their patients to provide the best possible care. This includes the duty to listen to the patient's concerns, to explain things clearly, and to respect the patient's wishes.Medical care is expensive, and it is often necessary to make choices about which treatments to provide and which to withhold. These choices are difficult, and they must be made with the best interests of the patient in mind.

The word nursing can be used in a few different ways. It can be a profession, whereby someone takes care of the sick or elderly, or it can refer to the act of breastfeeding an infant. Nursing can also be used as a verb, meaning to give care or attention to someone who is ill.The word nursing is derived from the Old English word hūsnyss, which means ‘household duties’. In the Middle Ages, women who were employed as nurses were responsible for all the domestic tasks in a sick person’s home, such as cooking and cleaning. The word nursing began to be used specifically to refer to the care of the sick in the late 17th century.The first nurses werereligious women who tended to the sick in their homes or in hospital. In the 19th century, the nursing profession began to professionalize, with the establishment of training schools for nurses. The first nursing school in the United States was established in 1873.Today, nursing is a highly respected profession, and nurses play a vital role in the healthcare system. In the United States, there are over 3 million nurses, making it the largest healthcare profession. Nurses provide care for patients in a variety of settings, such as hospitals, doctor’s offices, clinics, and nursing homes.Nurses have a wide range of responsibilities, including taking patient histories, administering medications, and monitoring patients’ vital signs. They also provide emotional support to patients and their families.Becoming a nurse requires completing an accredited nursing program, which typically takes 2-4 years. Nurses must also pass a national licensing exam. In addition to their clinical duties, nurses also have administrative and management responsibilities.As the population ages and the demand for healthcare services increases, the need for nurses will continue to grow. Nurses play a vital role in ensuring that patients receive the best possible care, and they will continue to be an essential part of the healthcare system.

A part is a piece or section of something such as a machine, an animal, a plant, a manufacturing process, or a building. Parts are often interchangeable, and they may be produced individually or in batches. OEM parts are made by the original equipment manufacturer, while aftermarket parts are made by other companies. Parts may be bought new, used, or refurbished.

In business, a service is an intangible product. Services are activities or benefits that one party can provide to another that are essentially intangible and do not result in the ownership of anything. The concept of service is therefore distinct from the concept of goods. In economics, a service is a transaction in which no physical goods change hands. The benefits of such a service are held to be demonstrated by the buyer's willingness to make the exchange. Public services are those that society (nation state, fiscal union, region, local government, etc.) as a whole pays for. Using resources, skill, ingenuity, and experience, service providers benefit service consumers. Service providers often market their services to potential consumers using an advertising campaign.

A community is a group of people who interact with each other on a regular basis. The term can refer to a group of friends, a group of co-workers, or even a group of people who share a common interest.The word "community" is often used to describe a group of people who have something in common. For example, you might say that you're a part of the LGBT community, the black community, or the deaf community. Communities can be small or large. A small community might be a group of friends who live in the same apartment complex. A large community might be a group of people who share the same religious beliefs. Communities can also be online. For example, there are online communities for fans of different TV shows, books, or video games.The word "community" is also used to describe a feeling of togetherness. For example, you might say that your town has a close-knit community. This means that the people in your town are friendly and look out for each other.

The word needy can be used to describe a person or a group of people who lack the basic necessities of life. This can include things like food, shelter, clothing, and healthcare. While there are many organizations and individuals who work to help those in need, there are still far too many people who go without the basic necessities of life. This is especially true in developing countries where resources are scarce and poverty is rampant. Unfortunately, even in developed countries like the United States, there are many people who are considered to be needy. In 2017, it was estimated that there were over 40 million people living in poverty in the US. This means that they were living below the poverty line, which is set at an annual income of $12,060 for an individual or $24,600 for a family of four. While there are government programs in place to help those in need, such as food stamps and Medicaid, these programs are not always enough to meet the needs of those who qualify for them. This can leave many people feeling hopeless and desperate.

An expense is a cost that is incurred in order to generate revenue. The concept of an expense is important in accounting and finance, because it represents a necessary outlay of resources in order to generate income.Expenses can be classified in a number of ways, but the most common method is to categorize them according to their function within a business. The three main categories of expenses are operating expenses, marketing and advertising expenses, and general and administrative expenses.Operating expenses are those that are directly related to the production of goods or services. This would include things like the cost of raw materials, wages of factory workers, and so on. Marketing and advertising expenses are those that are incurred in order to promote and sell a product or service. General and administrative expenses are those that are not directly related to the production or sale of a product or service, but are necessary for the running of the business. These would include things like rent, utilities, and insurance.Expenses can also be classified according to their tax treatment. Business expenses are deductible from a company's taxable income, which can reduce the amount of taxes that the company owes. Personal expenses are not deductible from tax, and so the individual incurring the expense must pay the full amount of taxes on the income earned.There are a few different ways to control expenses. The most common method is to budget for expenses in advance. This involves estimating the amount of money that will be needed for each category of expense, and setting aside that money in a separate account. Another method is to track expenses as they are incurred, and to compare the actual amount spent to the budgeted amount. This can help to identify areas where spending is exceeding the budget, and can help to make adjustments in future budgeting.The concept of an expense is important to understand in order to make sound financial decisions. Expenses can be classified in a number of ways, and can be controlled through budgeting and tracking. By understanding expenses, businesses and individuals can make informed decisions about where to allocate their resources.

When most people think of the word “stay,” they think of it as a verb meaning to remain in a particular place or to not leave. However, “stay” can also be used as a noun meaning a support or prop, something that keeps something else in place. For example, a stay at a hotel is a short-term support for someone who is traveling. In the same way, a lifeguard on duty is a stay for swimmers, there to keep them safe in case of an emergency.The word “stay” can trace its origins back to the Old English word “stæger,” which meant “stake” or “post.” This sense of the word as a support or prop is still seen in its modern usage. In the 14th century, the word took on the meaning of “remaining in a place,” which is how it is most commonly used today.When used as a verb, “stay” typically takes the meaning of “remaining” or “not leaving.” For example, someone might stay at home sick from work, or stay late to finish a project. It can also mean “to halt or stop,” as in “stay your hand” or “stay the course.” In this sense, “stay” is often used as a command or order, telling someone to not do something.As a noun, “stay” can mean a support or prop, as mentioned before. It can also refer to a period of time spent in a particular place, such as a vacation or holiday. In this sense, “stay” is often used in the phrases “short stay” or “long stay.” used as a verb:The baby stayed put in her crib while her mother cleaned the house.I'm going to stay here and finish this book.I'm sorry, but you're going to have to stay late to finish your presentation.The dog stayed behind as we walked to the park.Please stay the course, even though it's difficult.used as a noun:The hotel stay was nice, but it was too short.We're looking for a long-term stay in an apartment.The lifeguard on duty is a stay for swimmers.

A cut is a wound caused by sharp object, typically a knife or glass. It can also be caused by an animal bite. Cuts are usually not very deep, but can be dangerous if the object that caused the wound was dirty or if the wound is in a sensitive area such as the eye. If a cut is more than a quarter inch deep, it may need to be stitched up by a medical professional.

When it comes to taxes, a deductible is an expense that can be subtracted from your taxable income. This lowers your overall tax bill because you're only paying taxes on the income you have after deducting your expenses. Common deductions include things like mortgage interest, charitable donations, and medical expenses. To be deductible, an expense must meet certain criteria set by the IRS. For example, it must be considered a necessary and ordinary expense for running your business or earning income. Additionally, you must have documentation to prove that you paid the expense.Deductions are a key part of the tax code and can save you money on your taxes if you qualify. If you're not sure whether an expense is deductible, it's a good idea to speak with a tax advisor. They can help you determine if an expense meets the criteria set by the IRS and can help you maximize your deductions.

Malingering is a term used to describe the act of feigning or exaggerating illness or injury in order to avoid work, military service, or other unpleasant tasks. The motives for malingering can vary, but often include financial gain, avoiding a difficult situation, or simply, laziness.Malingering is not considered a mental disorder, but rather a purposeful act. However, it can be difficult to differentiate between malingering and actual mental or physical illness, as the line between the two is often blurred. This is particularly true in cases where an individual is both physically and mentally unwell.There are a number of ways to detect malingering, which can help to confirm or rule out a diagnosis. One method is to look for inconsistencies in an individual's story. For example, if someone claiming to have a back injury is able to walk without pain, this may be an indication that they are malingering.Other signs of malingering include exaggeration of symptoms, unwillingness to cooperate with testing or treatment, and a sudden onset of symptoms that are not consistent with the illness or injury being claimed.If malingering is suspected, it is important to rule out any underlying physical or mental health conditions that could be causing the individual to behave in this way. Once any underlying conditions have been ruled out, a diagnosis of malingering can be made.While malingering is not a crime, it can have serious consequences. For example, if someone is malingering in order to avoid military service, they may be putting themselves and others at risk. Likewise, if someone is malingering in order to receive financial compensation, they may be taking advantage of a system that is meant to help those who are genuinely in need.Malingering is a complex issue, and one that requires careful consideration on a case-by-case basis. In some cases, it may be difficult to differentiate between malingering and an underlying physical or mental health condition. However, with careful evaluation, it is typically possible to make a diagnosis.

Overcrowding is a pressing social issue in many parts of the world today. It occurs when the population in a given area exceeds the capacity of the area to comfortably accommodate them. This can lead to a number of problems, including inadequate housing, lack of access to essential services, and social disharmony.Overcrowding is often the result of rapid population growth. This can be due to natural factors, such as a high birth rate, or to immigration. When families move to a new area in search of better opportunities, they may find themselves living in cramped and unsatisfactory conditions.The consequences of overcrowding can be serious. People may be forced to live in squalid, unsafe, and unhealthy conditions. This can lead to the spread of disease, and to mental and physical health problems. Overcrowded areas may also experience heightened levels of crime and violence.There are a number of ways to address the problem of overcrowding. Governments can invest in infrastructure and services to accommodate a growing population. They can also implement policies to discourage immigration and encourage family planning. However, these measures cannot be effective unless they are accompanied by a genuine commitment to tackling the underlying causes of overcrowding.

The study of medicine is a long and varied one, encompassing everything from the human body and its many functions, to the myriad of diseases and ailments that can beset it. The history of medicine is just as long and varied, with different cultures and civilizations developing their own methods and treatments for illness and injury.Modern medicine has its roots in both traditional and alternative practices. The traditional approach relies on the use of drugs and surgery to treat diseases, while the alternative approach emphasizes the use of natural remedies and the body's own ability to heal itself.The practice of medicine is constantly evolving, as new knowledge is gained about the human body and the diseases that afflict it. Every day, new breakthroughs are made that help to improve the quality of life for people all over the world. Medicine is a vital part of the healthcare system, and it plays a vital role in the health of individuals and communities. It is an essential part of our lives, and it will continue to be so for many years to come.

Prepayment is defined as the payment of something, especially money, before it is due. Prepayment can be made for a variety of items, including but not limited to: rent, mortgage, car insurance, utilities, and cable/satellite TV service. There are many advantages to prepaying for items, including but not limited to: avoiding late fees, building good credit, and receiving discounts.Prepaying for something is the act of making a payment for it before it is actually due. This can be done for a number of different items, such as rent, a mortgage, car insurance, utilities, and even cable or satellite TV service. There are a number of advantages to prepaying for items, the most notable of which are avoiding late fees, building good credit, and receiving discounts.When it comes to paying rent, for example, prepaying can help you avoid costly late fees. If you're ever short on cash and can't make a full rent payment on time, prepaying can also give you some wiggle room to work with your landlord. As long as you've pre-paid for the month, you shouldn't have to worry about being charged a late fee.Prepaying can also help you build good credit. If you have good credit, you'll likely qualify for lower interest rates on loans and credit cards. This can save you a significant amount of money over time. Additionally, good credit can also help you get approved for apartment rentals, car rentals, and even jobs.Last but not least, prepaying can get you discounts. Many companies offer discounts to customers who prepay for their services. For example, you may be able to get a discount on your car insurance if you pay for a whole year upfront. utilities companies also sometimes offer discounts to customers who prepay for their service.Prepaying has a number of advantages that can save you money and help you out in a pinch. It's important to weigh the pros and cons of prepaying before you make any decisions. For some people, prepaying is a great way to save money and avoid headaches down the road.

When one thinks of freedom, they may think of being free from something, such as oppression, fear, or pain. However, freedom can also mean being free to do something, or to live in a certain way. Freedom is often associated with liberty, which is the state of being free from external control or interference.The concept of freedom has been around for centuries, and has been debated by philosophers, politicians, and everyday people. Freedom is a complex concept, with many different interpretations. Some believe that freedom is the ability to do whatever one wants, without restrictions. Others believe that freedom is being able to live in a way that is true to oneself, without compromising one's values. Freedom can also be thought of as a lack of limitations. For example, a person may be free to choose their own path in life, or free to express themselves in any way they choose. A society may be considered free if its members are able to choose their own leaders, or if they have the right to free speech and free assembly.Freedom is often considered a fundamental human right. This is because freedom allows people to live in a way that is authentic to them, and to pursue their own happiness. When people are not free, they may be oppressed, or living in fear.The fight for freedom has been a major theme throughout history. oppressed groups have fought for their freedom from tyranny, and people have fought for the freedom to live their lives in accordance with their own values. The fight for freedom continues today, as people around the world strive to live in a way that is true to themselves.

A student is a person who attends an educational institution, typically one who is enrolled in a course of study in order to receive a degree. In the United States, a student is typically someone who is between the ages of 18 and 22. The term "student" can also be used to refer to someone who is currently enrolled in a course but is not necessarily seeking a degree.There are many different types of students. Some students are full-time, which means they attend school and take classes during the day. Other students are part-time, which means they take classes at night or on the weekends. Some students are also online students, which means they take classes entirely online. There are also students who are home-schooled, which means they are educated at home by their parents or by a tutor.The term "student" is also used to refer to someone who is currently enrolled in a course but is not necessarily seeking a degree. In this case, the student is generally enrolled in a class in order to gain knowledge or skills, but not for the purpose of earning a degree.There are a variety of reasons why people become students. Some students are trying to earn a degree in order to get a job after graduation. Others are taking classes in order to improve their knowledge in a particular subject. And still others are taking classes simply for the love of learning.Whatever the reason for becoming a student, one thing is certain: the student life is not always easy. Students have to juggle their class schedules, their social lives, and their work schedules. They also have to deal with the stress of exams and papers. But the student life can also be incredibly rewarding. It is a time when people are exploring new things, meeting new people, and learning more about themselves and the world around them.

Dentistry is the branch of medicine that is concerned with the diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of diseases, disorders and conditions of the oral cavity, the maxillofacial region and the adjacent structures and tissues, particularly the teeth.Dentistry is widely considered to be one of the oldest medical professions, dating back to around 7000 BC. Early dentistry was often associated with magic and superstition, and it was not until the 19th century that it began to be scientifically based.The term ‘dentistry’ is derived from the Latin word ‘dens’, meaning tooth. The first evidence of dental treatment dates back to around 7000 BC, when the Sumerians in Mesopotamia (modern day Iraq) were using sharpened flint to decontaminate teeth.The Egyptians are thought to have been the first to use gold for dental work, around 500 BC. By 200 BC, the Greek physician Hippocrates was advocating the use of forceps to extract teeth, and the Romans developed a number of techniques for restoring decayed teeth.Dentistry was not always a profession in its own right; in many cultures it was the responsibility of the barber or blacksmith. In the Middle Ages, barbers and surgeons were often one and the same, and it was not until the 15th century that the two professions began to divergence.It was not until the 18th century that dentistry began to develop as a distinct profession. In 1723, French surgeon Pierre Fauchard published ‘The Surgeon Dentist’, a treatise on dental surgery that is considered to be the first scientific work on the subject.Fauchard is widely regarded as the ‘father of modern dentistry’, and his work helped to move the profession away from its superstitious and often harmful roots. In the 19th century, advances in dental science continued, with the development of dental anaesthesia and the introduction of the first dental schools.Today, dentistry is a highly developed and regulated profession. Dentists must undergo extensive training in order to practise, and they must adhere to strict codes of conduct. Dentistry is an important part of the healthcare system, and it plays a vital role in maintaining the oral health of the population.

A scholarship is an award of financial aid for a student to further their education. Scholarships are awarded based on various criteria, which typically reflect the values and purposes of the donor or organization who established the award. Scholarships can be need-based, merit-based, or designated for specific groups of people.Need-based scholarships are awarded to students based on their financial need. These scholarships are typically awarded by colleges or universities to help make college more affordable for students from low-income families. Merit-based scholarships are awarded to students based on their academic, artistic, or athletic achievement. These scholarships can be awarded by colleges, universities, or private organizations. Some scholarships are designated for specific groups of people, such as women, minorities, or students with a disability. These scholarships may be awarded by colleges, universities, or private organizations.  Scholarships typically range in value from a few hundred dollars to full tuition. Some scholarships also cover additional expenses, such as room and board or books and supplies.Scholarships are a form of financial aid that can help make college more affordable. Scholarships are typically awarded based on financial need, academic achievement, or for belonging to a specific group of people. Scholarships can range in value from a few hundred dollars to full tuition.

In a democracy, government is the means by which the will of the people is expressed and implemented. It is the machinery through which citizens exercise their rights and responsibilities in relation to each other and to the state.The concept of government embraces a wide range of activities and institutions, from the family to the nation state. It is concerned with formal and informal relationships between people, with the ways in which power is distributed and exercised, and with the rules that govern social behaviour.The study of government is a central part of politics. It covers the theories and principles of government, and the analysis of actual systems of government in practice. It is concerned with the nature and exercise of power, and the constraints on that power.There are a number of different approaches to the study of government. The most common are the normative and the positive.The normative approach is concerned with what government ought to be. It asks questions about the nature of the good society, and the best way of achieving it. The positive approach is concerned with what government actually is. It asks questions about the way power is exercised, and the rules that govern social behaviour.The study of government has a long history. The ancient Greeks were among the first to think systematically about the nature of the state and the best way of governing it. The Roman Empire was another early example of a complex system of government in practice.The study of government has traditionally been divided into three main branches: political theory, comparative politics, and international relations.Political theory is concerned with the nature of the state and the best way of governing it. It asks normative questions about the nature of the good society, and the best way of achieving it.Comparative politics is concerned with the study of different political systems in practice. It asks positive questions about the way power is exercised, and the rules that govern social behaviour.International relations is concerned with the relations between states. It asks questions about the way power is exercised, and the rules that govern social behaviour.The study of government is a central part of politics. It helps us to understand the nature of the state, the way power is exercised, and the rules that govern social behaviour. It is essential for those who want to take part in the political process, and for those who want to influence the direction of government policy.

A grant is a sum of money awarded to an individual, business, or organization by a government entity or private donor to be used for a specific purpose. Grants are typically given out for research, educational, or charitable purposes. The grant application process is usually competitive, and grant recipients are usually required to submit reports detailing how the money was spent and what outcomes were achieved.There are many different types of grants available, and the eligibility requirements and application process vary depending on the grant program. Some of the most popular grant programs include the National Science Foundation (NSF) Grants for Small Businesses, the National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH) Grants, and the National Institutes of Health (NIH) Grants.The NSF Grants for Small Businesses program provides small businesses with the funding they need to conduct research and develop innovative products and services. The NEH Grants program provides humanities scholars with funding for research, education, and public programming projects that promote the understanding of our nation's history and culture. The NIH Grants program provides funding for medical research and training.To apply for a grant, you will need to submit a proposal outlining your project and how it will promote the goals of the grant program. Your proposal will be reviewed by a panel of experts, and if it is approved, you will be awarded the grant.Grant recipients are required to submit reports detailing their project's progress and outcomes. These reports help the government or private donor to assess the impact of their investment and make decisions about future funding.If you are considering applying for a grant, you should research the various grant programs to find one that best suits your needs. You should also speak with a grants specialist to get advice on the application process.

The capacity of something is its maximum possible volume, weight, or capacity. It is the power or ability to do something. A few examples of capacity are:The capacity of a car's gas tankThe weight capacity of a bridgeThe passenger capacity of an airplaneThe maximum speed limit on a highwayCapacity is usually determined by the physical limitations of the object in question. For example, the capacity of a car's gas tank is determined by the size of the tank. The weight capacity of a bridge is determined by the strength of the materials used to build the bridge. The passenger capacity of an airplane is determined by the size of the plane.Capacity can also be determined by legal restrictions. For example, the maximum speed limit on a highway is determined by the legal speed limit.Capacity is often used in reference to storage. For example, a computer's storage capacity is the amount of data that can be stored on the computer. A person's mental capacity is the amount of information that they can remember.When discussing capacity, it is important to consider the units of measurement. For example, the capacity of a car's gas tank is usually measured in gallons. The weight capacity of a bridge is usually measured in tons. The passenger capacity of an airplane is usually measured in seats.It is also important to consider the safety margins when discussing capacity. For example, the capacity of a car's gas tank is usually less than the actual capacity of the tank. This is because there needs to be a safety margin for error.In general, capacity is the maximum possible volume, weight, or capacity of something. It is the power or ability to do something. Capacity is usually determined by the physical limitations of the object in question but can also be determined by legal restrictions. Capacity is often used in reference to storage. When discussing capacity, it is important to consider the units of measurement and the safety margins.

An area is a space that is defined in relation to some other space. It is usually two-dimensional, but can also be three-dimensional. Areas can be measured in a variety of ways, such as by their width and height, or by their circumference.Areas are generally used to denote the size of a given space, such as a room in a house or an open field. But they can also be used more abstractly, such as to measure a person's weight or the amount of money in a bank account. Additionally, the term "area" can be used to refer to a section or part of something, such as an area of a city that is known for its high crime rate.When referring to geography, an area can be small, like a country or large, like a continent. It can be a measure of land, like acreage, or of water, like in square miles. It can also bePolitical boundaries, like in the case of a state or province, are often times based on area. The word "area" is derived from the Latin word "area," which means "open space."

A dollar is a unit of currency in many different countries. It is also the name of the currency in the United States of America. One dollar is worth 100 cents. There are many different coins and bills that are worth one dollar. The dollar is a very common currency, and it is easy to find in most places.

The word 'appropriation' has many different meanings, but most commonly refers to the act of taking something for one's own use, without permission. This can be done with physical objects, like taking someone's wallet, or with ideas, like plagiarizing a paper. It can also refer to the act of taking something that belongs to a culture or group that one is not a part of, such as appropriating a Native American headdress. Appropriation can be done with good or bad intentions, and can be seen as either positive or negative, depending on the context.

A sum is an amount of money, typically referring to a particular amount of money that is given in exchange for something, or that is given as part of a larger amount. Sum can also be used as a verb, meaning to add up a group of numbers or amounts. For example, if you're trying to calculate a tip at a restaurant, you would sum the cost of the meal and the tax to come up with the total amount.

A field is a geographic area identified by a given set of boundaries. It is usually defined within the context of a specific land-use application, such as agriculture, grazing, forestry, or urban planning. The term can also be used more broadly, as in the case of a field of study, or a field of inquiry.The word "field" comes from the Old English word feld, which means "open country." The concept of a field has been present in human societies since the dawn of agriculture, when our ancestors first began to settle down and cultivate the land. In the millennia since then, the use and meaning of the word "field" has evolved to meet the needs of a changing world.Today, fields are an integral part of our lives. They provide us with the food we eat, the materials we use to build our homes and roads, and the spaces where we play and relax. They are also the places where we conduct important research and make important discoveries.Fields will continue to be a vital part of our lives in the future. As we face the challenges of a changing climate and a growing population, we will need to use fields more efficiently and creatively. We will also need to protect and conserve the world's fields, so that they can continue to provide us with the resources and benefits we rely on.

A bureau is a piece of furniture with drawers and typically a writing surface on top. Bureaux are often used as places to store and organize important papers and documents. In the United Kingdom, the term "bureau" is also used to refer to government departments or agencies.The word "bureau" has its origins in the French language. It entered the English language in the late 17th century and has been used to refer to a variety of different things over the years.The firstKnown use of the word "bureau" in English was in 1688, when it was used to refer to a piece of furniture with drawers. The word likely came into English from the French word "bureau", which means "desk".In the United Kingdom, the term "bureau" is used to refer to government departments or agencies. The word is used in this way because these departments and agencies are typically responsible for the collection and dissemination of information.The word "bureau" can also be used to refer to a business, such as a travel agency or a news agency.In general, the word "bureau" is used to refer to a place where people go to get work done. This can be a physical location, such as an office, or it can refer to a collection of resources, such as a website or a set of records.

An institute is an advanced educational institution, typically one devoted to one particular branch of learning. They are usually research-oriented and post-graduate. Institutes offer both undergraduate and graduate degrees, and sometimes doctorates as well. The research conducted at institutes often forms the basis for advances in their respective fields.In the United States, there are many renowned institutes, such as the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT), which is known for its science and engineering programs, and the Juilliard School, which is a top performing arts institute. Other notable institutes include the Culinary Institute of America, the Fashion Institute of Technology, and the Rhode Island School of Design.Outside of the US, some of the most famous institutes include the Sorbonne in Paris, France, and the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art in London, England. In addition to offering degrees, institutes often host lectures and seminars open to the public, which help disseminate new knowledge and ideas. They may also have museums and art galleries on their campuses, which help promote the arts and sciences to the wider community.

Rehabilitation is the process of helping a person to recover from an injury or illness, and return to normal life and activities. It can be physical, mental, or both. The aim of rehabilitation is to restore the person to their previous level of function, or as close to it as possible.Rehabilitation usually begins soon after the injury or illness, and may continue for months or even years. It may be done in a hospital, clinic, or at home. In some cases, it may be the only treatment that is needed. In others, it may be used alongside other treatments, such as surgery, medication, or physical therapy.Rehabilitation may involve different types of therapies, depending on the person’s needs. These may include exercises to improve strength, flexibility, and range of motion; occupational therapy to help with daily activities; and speech and language therapy to help with communication.Some people make a full recovery and are able to return to their previous level of function. Others may have some permanent, but minor, limitations. Still others may require long-term or lifelong assistance.

Knowledge is a noun that refers to the state or fact of knowing something. It can also refer to the sum of what is known, as well as the theoretical or practical understanding of a subject. It is often used in conjunction with other words, such as "knowledge is power."Knowledge is often divided into two categories: empirical knowledge, which is based on experience or observation, and theoretical knowledge, which is based on reason or logic. Empirical knowledge is often seen as more reliable, since it is based on data that can be observed and verified. Theoretical knowledge is often seen as less reliable, since it is based on assumptions that may not be true.There are different types of knowledge, such as declarative knowledge, which is knowledge that can be stated or declared; procedural knowledge, which is knowledge of how to do something; and factual knowledge, which is knowledge of facts or information.Knowledge is acquired in different ways, such as through education, experience, or research. It can be acquired passively, such as through listening to a lecture, or actively, such as through reading a book.Knowledge is important because it allows us to understand the world around us and make better decisions. It is also important because it can be used to power, as in the phrase "knowledge is power."

Dirksen may refer to:People* Everett Dirksen (1896–1969), American politician* Brian Dirksen (born 1967), Canadian rower* Frits Dirksen (1923–2005), Dutch footballer and manager* Hendrik Dirksen (born 1967), Dutch javelin thrower* Jan Dirksen (born 1981), Dutch footballer* Lennart Dirksen (born 1946), Dutch rower* Dirksen Lentulfus (born c.990 – 1046/1047), Frisian noblemanGiven name* Dirksen L hesitation, a figure skating movePeople with the middle name Dirksen* Marco van Basten (born 1964), Dutch football player and manager, full name Marcel Dirksen van Basten* Willem-Alexander of the Netherlands (born 1967), Dutch king, full name Willem-Alexander Claus George Ferdinand DirksenPlaces* Dirksen, Illinois, an unincorporated community in the United States* Dirksen Senate Office Building, a United States Senate office building in Washington, D.C.Other uses* Dirksen language, a Ubangian language spoken in the Central African Republic

The Republican Party is one of the two major political parties in the United States, the other being the Democratic Party. The party is also commonly referred to as the GOP, which stands for "Grand Old Party." The party's platform generally focuses on conservatism, fiscal responsibility, and social values. The party has also been known to support limited government and a strong national defense.The Republican Party traces its roots back to the anti-slavery movement in the 1830s. The party was officially founded in 1854 by a group ofAnti-Slavery activists in Ripon, Wisconsin. The party's first president was Abraham Lincoln, who was elected in 1860. Lincoln's election marked a turning point in American history, as it ushered in a new era of Civil War and Reconstruction.In the years following the Civil War, the Republican Party became the party of big business and laissez-faire capitalism. The party's support for big business and industry made it unpopular with farmers and laborers, and the party began to lose support in the late 1800s. The election of 1896 was a turning point for the party, as Republican William McKinley defeated Democrat William Jennings Bryan. McKinley's victory signaled a return to conservative values and a focus on economic growth.The early 1900s were a period of political and economic turmoil, and the Republican Party was unable to maintain control of the Presidency. The election of 1912 was a turning point for the party, as Theodore Roosevelt, a former Republican, ran on the Progressive Party ticket and won. Roosevelt's victory signaled a move away from the party's conservative roots and a move toward more progressive policies.The Republican Party regained control of the Presidency in 1920, and the party would go on to hold the Presidency for most of the next two decades. The Great Depression of the 1930s dealt a blow to the party, and Democrat Franklin Roosevelt was elected in 1932. Roosevelt's New Deal policies expanded the role of the federal government and led to a realignment of the political parties. The New Deal Coalition of Democrats and liberals was opposed by the conservative coalition of Republicans and southern Democrats.The election of 1952 was a turning point for the Republican Party, as Dwight Eisenhower was elected President. Eisenhower's victory signaled a return to the party's conservative roots and a focus on national security. The election of 1980 was another turning point for the party, as Ronald Reagan was elected President. Reagan's election ushered in a new era of conservatism, and the party has been associated with conservative values ever since.

In military science, a halleck is a functional equivalent to a commanding general or theater commander. The term is used in land and naval warfare. A halleck may also be responsible for overall strategy in a theater of operations.The origin of the term is unclear, but it is believed to be derived from the German word Halbzeit, meaning "half time." In the 18th and 19th centuries, a halleck was often a staff officer who assisted a commanding general.In the 20th century, the term came to be used more broadly, and is now used to describe the commander of a theater of operations. A halleck may also be responsible for overall strategy in a theater of operations.A halleck is responsible for the coordination of military resources in a theater of operations. This includes the movements of troops, equipment, and supplies. A halleck also plans and executes campaigns, and is responsible for the welfare of soldiers in the theater.A halleck must be able to think and plan strategically, and must be able to understand and use complex computerized systems. A halleck must also be able to communicate effectively with political and military leaders.

A speaker is a person who delivers a speech, lecture, or sermon. They are usually proficient in public speaking and have extensive knowledge on the subject they are speaking about. A speaker can be anyone from a politician to a teacher, and their speeches can be about anything from current events to history.While the main purpose of a speaker is to inform their audience, they can also entertain, inspire, and motivate them. A good speaker will capture their audience's attention and hold it throughout the entirety of their speech. They will also be able to effectively communicate their message, whether it be complex or simple.There are certain techniques that can help a speaker deliver their speech in an effective manner. For example, they should use their voice and body language to convey their emotions and connect with their audience. They should also keep their speeches well-organized and avoid going off on tangents.Overall, a speaker is someone who is able to captivate an audience and communicate their message in an effective way. They play an important role in society, as they can educate, entertain, and inspire people.

A rayburn is a type of stove that uses a renewable source of energy, such as wood, to provide heat for a home. Typically, a rayburn has a back boiler that can be used to provide hot water and central heating for a home. Some models of rayburn also have the ability to cook food.

A thing is an object that can be seen or touched. It can be a physical object, such as a table or a chair, or it can be an intangible object, such as a thought or a feeling. Things can be simple or complex. They can be static, like a rock, or they can be dynamic, like a moving object. Things can be animate, like a person, or inanimate, like a book.Things can be described in terms of their properties, such as their size, shape, color, or texture. They can also be described in terms of their function, such as what they are used for or what they do. Things can be grouped together based on their similarities or their differences.There are an infinite number of things in the world, and new things are always being discovered. Things can be studied in fields such as anthropology, archaeology, astronomy, biology, chemistry, physics, and psychology.

A prediction is a statement or claim about what will happen in the future. It is often based on experience or knowledge, but can also be based on opinion or gut feeling.Predictions are made all the time, from small things like what the weather will be tomorrow, to much bigger things like who will win an election. Sometimes, predictions come true, and sometimes they don't. But even when they are wrong, making predictions can be interesting and fun.There are all sorts of different kinds of predictions. Some people like to make serious predictions about things like the economy or the stock market. Others like to make more fun predictions, like who will be the next big movie star. There are even people who make predictions about the future of the world, or what will happen in the next life.Predictions can be a helpful way to plan for the future. But they can also be dangerous, especially when they are used to make important decisions. That's why it's important to remember that predictions are only ever educated guesses, and they should never be taken too seriously.

Pressure is a force that is applied to an object by another object. The pressure on an object is equal to the force applied to it divided by the area over which the force is applied. The SI unit of pressure is the pascal (Pa), which is equal to one newton per square metre (N/m2).Pressure is a scalar quantity, which means that it has a magnitude but no direction. It is often used to represent the amount of force that is exerted by a fluid on a surface. The pressure of a fluid is caused by the weight of the fluid and the acceleration due to gravity.The pressure of a fluid also depends on the density of the fluid and the temperature. For example, the pressure of a gas is usually greater than the pressure of a liquid. The pressure of a gas is also affected by its compressibility.The pressure of a fluid can be measured using a manometer. A manometer is a tube with a U-shaped bend in it. The fluid is placed in the U-shaped tube and the pressure is measured by the height of the fluid in the tube.The atmospheric pressure is the pressure of the atmosphere on the surface of the Earth. The atmospheric pressure is caused by the weight of the air in the atmosphere. The atmospheric pressure is normally about 101.3 kilopascals (kPa).The atmospheric pressure can be measured using a barometer. A barometer is a tube with a mercury-filled reservoir at the bottom. The atmospheric pressure is measured by the height of the mercury in the tube.

The word 'tonight' has many different connotations. It can be used to describe the night sky, to signify the end of the day, or to refer to a social event. It is also a common word in popular culture, often appearing in song lyrics and spoken word.When used to describe the night sky, 'tonight' often carries a sense of wonder and awe. The star-filled sky can be seen as a metaphor for the infinite possibilities that life offers. It can also be a reminder of the transience of life, and how we are all just a small part of something much bigger.When used to signify the end of the day, 'tonight' can be a time of reflection and peace. It can also be a time of excitement and anticipation, as we look forward to the evening ahead. When used to refer to a social event, 'tonight' usually denotes a time of fun and relaxation. It can be a chance to let loose and forget about the worries of the day. Whether we are going out for drinks with friends or staying in for a cozy night at home, 'tonight' is a time to enjoy the company of those we love.No matter how it is used, the word 'tonight' carries with it a sense of possibility. It is a reminder that each day is a new beginning, and that we have the power to create our own destiny. Tonight is a time to dream, to hope, and to believe that anything is possible.

Weavers are traditional craftspeople who use a loom to create fabric by interlacing yarn or thread. Weaving is one of the oldest textile arts, with evidence of prehistoric fabrics dating back to as early as the Paleolithic period. Throughout history, weavers have played an important role in cultures around the world, providing not only functional but also decorative fabrics.Today, weaving is still a popular pastime, with many people enjoying the creative process and the satisfaction of working with their hands to create something beautiful. looms come in a variety of sizes and types, from simple hand-held frames to intricate floor-standing machines. There is a huge range of fabrics that can be created, from light and airy summer cottons to heavy winter wools.Whether you are a beginner or an experienced weaver, there is always something new to learn. For those just starting out, there are many helpful books and online tutorials available to guide you through the basics. Once you have mastered the basics, you can start experimenting with different patterns and techniques to create unique fabrics. For experienced weavers, there is always something new to learn, whether it is a new weaving technique or a new way to finish a fabric.Weaving is a relaxing and enjoyable activity that can be enjoyed by people of all ages and abilities. It is a great way to express your creativity and make something beautiful and unique.

Housing refers to the physical structures that people use to live in and shelter themselves from the natural environment. The word can also be used to refer to the act of providing people with a place to live. Housing is a basic human need and is essential for human beings to survive and thrive.There are many different types of housing, from simple tents and huts to complex buildings with multiple levels and sophisticated features. The type of housing that people live in depends on a variety of factors, including climate, available resources, and personal preferences.In most cases, housing is created using materials that are readily available in the local environment. For example, people who live in cold climates may use wood and stone to build sturdy homes that will protect them from the elements. In warm climates, people may use materials like straw and mud to construct homes that will stay cool in the heat.Housing can also be influence by cultural factors. In some cultures, homes are built around a central courtyard, while in others, homes are built with multiple rooms that are arranged in a linear fashion.The way that housing is organized can also vary from place to place. In some cases, people live in individual homes, while in others, they may live in apartment buildings or other types of communal living arrangements.There are many benefits to having access to safe and secure housing. Housing provides people with a place to rest and feel protected from the outside world. It also offers people a space to store their belongings and keep them safe. Additionally, housing can be used as a base from which people can go out and explore their surroundings.Housing is an important part of people's lives and has a significant impact on their health, well-being, and quality of life. access to safe and secure housing is a fundamental human right.
wik: His Majesty's Home Civil Service, also known as His Majesty's Civil Service, the Home Civil Service, or colloquially as the Civil Service is the permanent bureaucracy or secretariat of Crown employees that supports His Majesty's Government, which is led by a cabinet of ministers chosen by the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, as well as two of the three devolved administrations: the Scottish Government and the Welsh Government, but not the Northern Ireland Executive.As in other states that employ the Westminster political system, His Majesty's Home Civil Service forms an inseparable part of the British government. The executive decisions of government ministers are implemented by HM Civil Service. Civil servants are employees of the Crown and not of the British parliament. Civil servants also have some traditional and statutory responsibilities which to some extent protect them from being used for the political advantage of the party in power. Senior civil servants may be called to account to Parliament.In general use, the term civil servant in the United Kingdom does not include all public sector employees. Although there is no fixed legal definition, the.

A county is a geographic region of a country used for administrative or other purposes in certain modern nations. The term is derived from the Old French comté  denoting a jurisdiction under the sovereignty of a count (earl) or a viscount. Literal equivalents in other languages, derived from the equivalent of "count", are now seldom used officially, including comté, contea, contado, comtat, condado, Grafschaft, graafschap, and zhupa in Slavic languages; terms equivalent to commune/community are now often instead used.When the Normans conquered England, they brought the term with them. The Saxons had already established the districts that became the historic counties of England, calling them shires; many county names derive from the name of the county town (county seat) with the word shire added on: for example, Gloucestershire and Worcestershire. The Anglo-Saxon terms earl and earldom were taken as equivalent to the continental terms "count" and "county" under the conquering Normans, and over time the two blended and became equivalent. Further, the later-imported term became a synonym for the native Old English word sċīr ([ʃiːr]) or, in Modern English, shire – an equivalent administrative division of the kingdom. The term "county" evolved,.

A currency is a standardization of money in any form, in use or circulation as a medium of exchange, for example banknotes and coins.A more general definition is that a currency is a system of money in common use within a specific environment over time, especially for people in a nation state. Under this definition, the British Pound Sterling (£), euros (€), Japanese yen (¥), and U.S. dollars (US$) are examples of (government-issued) fiat currencies. Currencies may act as stores of value and be traded between nations in foreign exchange markets, which determine the relative values of the different currencies..

A jury is a sworn body of people (jurors) convened to hear evidence and render an impartial verdict (a finding of fact on a question) officially submitted to them by a court, or to set a penalty or judgment. Juries developed in England during the Middle Ages and are a hallmark of the English common law system. As such, they are used by the United Kingdom, the United States, Canada, Ireland, Australia, and other countries whose legal systems were derived from the British Empire. But most other countries use variations of the European civil law or Islamic sharia law systems, in which juries are not generally used.Most trial juries are "petit juries", and usually consist of twelve people. Historically, a larger jury known as a grand jury was used to investigate potential crimes and render indictments against suspects. All common law countries except the United States and Liberia have phased these out. The modern criminal court jury arrangement has evolved out of the medieval juries in England. Members.

Friday is the day of the week between Thursday and Saturday. In countries that adopt the traditional "Sunday-first" convention, it is the sixth day of the week. In countries adopting the ISO-defined "Monday-first" convention, it is the fifth day of the week. 
In most Western countries, Friday is the fifth and final day of the working week. In some other countries, Friday is the first day of the weekend, with Saturday the second. 
In Israel, Friday is the sixth day of the week. In Iran, Friday is the last day of the weekend, with Saturday as the first day of the working week. Bahrain, the United Arab Emirates (UAE), Saudi Arabia and Kuwait also followed this convention until they changed to a Friday–Saturday weekend on September 1, 2006, in Bahrain and the UAE, and a year later in Kuwait. The UAE changed its weekend from Friday-Saturday to Saturday-Sunday on January 1, 2022.

Clinical trials are prospective biomedical or behavioral research studies on human participants designed to answer specific questions about biomedical or behavioral interventions, including new treatments (such as novel vaccines, drugs, dietary choices, dietary supplements, and medical devices) and known interventions that warrant further study and comparison. Clinical trials generate data on dosage, safety and efficacy. They are conducted only after they have received health authority/ethics committee approval in the country where approval of the therapy is sought. These authorities are responsible for vetting the risk/benefit ratio of the trial—their approval does not mean the therapy is 'safe' or effective, only that the trial may be conducted.Depending on product type and development stage, investigators initially enroll volunteers or patients into small pilot studies, and subsequently conduct progressively larger scale comparative studies. Clinical trials can vary in size and cost, and they can involve a single research center or multiple centers, in one country or in multiple countries. Clinical study design aims to ensure the scientific validity and reproducibility of the results.Costs for clinical trials can range into the billions of dollars.

An election is a formal group decision-making process by which a population chooses an individual or multiple individuals to hold public office.Elections have been the usual mechanism by which modern representative democracy has operated since the 17th century. Elections may fill offices in the legislature, sometimes in the executive and judiciary, and for regional and local government. This process is also used in many other private and business organisations, from clubs to voluntary associations and corporations.The global use of elections as a tool for selecting representatives in modern representative democracies is in contrast with the practice in the democratic archetype, ancient Athens, where the elections were considered an oligarchic institution and most political offices were filled using sortition, also known as allotment, by which officeholders were chosen by lot.Electoral reform describes the process of introducing fair electoral systems where they are not in place, or improving the fairness or effectiveness of existing systems. Psephology is the study of results and other statistics relating to elections (especially with a view to predicting future results). Election is the fact of electing, or being elected.To elect means "to select or make a decision", and so sometimes other forms.

Evidence for a proposition is what supports this proposition. It is usually understood as an indication that the supported proposition is true. What role evidence plays and how it is conceived varies from field to field.In epistemology, evidence is what justifies beliefs or what makes it rational to hold a certain doxastic attitude. For example, a perceptual experience of a tree may act as evidence that justifies the belief that there is a tree. In this role, evidence is usually understood as a private mental state. Important topics in this field include the questions of what the nature of these mental states is, for example, whether they have to be propositional, and whether misleading mental states can still qualify as evidence. In phenomenology, evidence is understood in a similar sense. Here, however, it is limited to intuitive knowledge that provides immediate access to truth and is therefore indubitable. In this role, it is supposed to provide ultimate justifications for basic philosophical principles and thus turn philosophy into a rigorous science. However, it is highly controversial whether evidence can meet these requirements. Other fields, including the sciences and the law, tend to emphasize more the public nature of evidence (for example, scientists tend to focus on how the data used during statistical inference are generated). In philosophy of science, evidence is understood as that which confirms or disconfirms scientific hypotheses. Measurements of Mercury's "anomalous" orbit, for example, are seen as evidence that confirms Einstein's theory of general relativity. In order to play the role of neutral arbiter between competing theories, it is important that scientific evidence is public and uncontroversial, like observable physical objects or events, so that the proponents of the different theories can agree on what the evidence is. This is ensured by following the scientific method and tends.

Architecture criticism is the critique of architecture. Everyday criticism relates to published or broadcast critiques of buildings, whether completed or not, both in terms of news and other criteria. In many cases, criticism amounts to an assessment of the architect's success in meeting his or her own aims and objectives and those of others. The assessment may consider the subject from the perspective of some wider context, which may involve planning, social or aesthetic issues. It may also take a polemical position reflecting the critic's own values. At the most accessible extreme, architectural criticism is a branch of lifestyle journalism, especially in the case of high-end residential projects.

A jury is a sworn body of people (jurors) convened to hear evidence and render an impartial verdict (a finding of fact on a question) officially submitted to them by a court, or to set a penalty or judgment. 
Juries developed in England during the Middle Ages and are a hallmark of the English common law system. As such, they are used by the United Kingdom, the United States, Canada, Ireland, Australia, and other countries whose legal systems were derived from the British Empire. But most other countries use variations of the European civil law or Islamic sharia law systems, in which juries are not generally used.
Most trial juries are "petit juries", and usually consist of twelve people. Historically, a larger jury known as a grand jury was used to investigate potential crimes and render indictments against suspects. All common law countries except the United States and Liberia have phased these out. The modern criminal court jury arrangement has evolved out of the medieval juries in England. Members were supposed to inform themselves of crimes and then of the details of the crimes. Their function was therefore closer to that of a grand jury than that of a jury in a trial.

A city is a human settlement of notable size. It can be defined as a permanent and densely settled place with administratively defined boundaries whose members work primarily on non-agricultural tasks. Cities generally have extensive systems for housing, transportation, sanitation, utilities, land use, production of goods,.

Account executive is a role in sales, advertising, marketing, and finance involving intimate understanding of a client company's objectives and products and a professional capability to provide effective advice toward creation of successful promotional activities and strategies. The account executive directly works with, and provides services to, one or more delegate officers or executives of the client company.

A committee or commission is a body of one or more persons subordinate to a deliberative assembly. A committee is not itself considered to be a form of assembly. Usually, the assembly sends matters into a committee as a way to explore them more fully than would be possible if the assembly itself were considering them. Committees may have different functions and their types of work differ depending on the type of the organization and its needs.
A member of a legislature may be delegated a committee assignment, which gives them the right to serve on a certain committee.

CHARGE syndrome (formerly known as CHARGE association) is a rare syndrome caused by a genetic disorder. First described in 1979, the acronym "CHARGE" came into use for newborn children with the congenital features of coloboma of the eye, heart defects, atresia of the nasal choanae, retardation of growth and/or development, genital and/or urinary abnormalities,.

Praise as a form of social interaction expresses recognition, reassurance or admiration.Praise is expressed verbally as well as by body language (facial expression and gestures).Verbal praise consists of a positive evaluations  of another's attributes or actions, where the evaluator presumes the validity of the standards on which the evaluation is based.As a form of social manipulation, praise becomes a form of reward and furthers behavioral reinforcement by conditioning.The influence of praise on an individual can depend on many factors, including the context, the meanings the praise may convey, and the characteristics and interpretations of the recipient. While praise may share some predictive relationships (both positive and negative) with tangible (material) rewards, praise tends to be less salient and expected, conveys more information about competence, and is typically given more immediately after the desired behavior.Praise is distinct from acknowledgement or feedback (more neutral forms of recognition) and from encouragement (expressedly future-oriented).Praise is given across social hierarchy, and both within.
Ivan Neville (born August 19, 1959) is an American multi-instrumentalist musician, singer, and songwriter. He is the son of Aaron Neville and nephew to members of The Neville Brothers.

Atlanta ( at-LAN-tə) is the capital and most populous city of the U.S. state of Georgia. It is the seat of Fulton County, the most populous county in Georgia, although a portion of the city extends into neighboring DeKalb county. With a population of 498,715 living within the city limits, it is the eighth most populous city in the Southeast and 38th most populous city in the United States according to the 2020 U.S. census. It is the core of the much larger Atlanta metropolitan area, which is home to more than 6.1 million people, making it the eighth-largest metropolitan area in the United States. Situated among the foothills of the Appalachian Mountains at an elevation of just over 1,000 feet (300 m) above sea level, it features unique topography that includes rolling hills, lush greenery, and the most dense urban tree coverage of any major city in the United States.Atlanta was originally founded as the terminus of a major state-sponsored railroad, but it soon became the convergence point among several railroads, spurring its rapid growth. The largest was the Western and Atlantic Railroad, from which the name "Atlanta" is derived, signifying the city's growing reputation as a major hub of transportation. During the American Civil War, it served a strategically important role for the Confederacy until it was captured in 1864. The city was almost entirely burnt to the ground during General William T. Sherman's March to the Sea. However, the city rebounded dramatically in the post-war period and quickly.

Manner Culture Enterprises Limited (simplified Chinese: 微辣文化集团有限公司; traditional Chinese: 微辣文化集團有限公司) is a Macau entertainment company. The company produces comedic videos in Cantonese that can be between a few seconds to a few minutes. It has a dozen performing artists under management.
Manner was founded in June 2013 by Sixtycents, Jacky Lei, and Nathan Lam in Macau. It became popular after it published a nine-second viral video set in a Macau McDonald's titled "When buying ice cream, don't be distracted", in which a woman who is distracted by her cell phone grabs the ice cream part of an ice cream cone from the cashier. The company expanded to Hong Kong in 2018 through a seven-figure investment from an undisclosed investor. Its revenue is primarily from advertising. It has made sponsored videos for Alipay, the Hong Kong Police Force, and Royal Dansk. Roughly 80% of its advertising revenue is from Hong Kong companies or organisations. Manner created a physical store called Laji in Sé, Macau, that sells Manner-branded snacks and souvenirs. Its revenue was over HKD$10 million (US$1,287,001.29) in 2017.
Manner posts videos on social networking services and online video platforms including Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, Sina Weibo, Meipai, Miaopai, Sohu, and iQIYI. It had accumulated three billion video views and over 3.5 million followers on these sites by 2018. The Macau Post Daily called Manner "one of the biggest YouTube channels in South East Asia".

An academic term (or simply term) is a portion of an academic year, the time during which an educational institution holds classes. The schedules adopted vary widely.
In most countries, the academic year begins in late summer or early autumn and ends during the following spring or summer. In Northern Hemisphere countries, this means that the academic year lasts from August, September, or October to May, June, or July. In Southern Hemisphere countries, the academic year aligns with the calendar year, lasting from February or March to November or December. The summer may or may not be part of the term system.

Abbot is an ecclesiastical title given to the male head of a monastery in various Western religious traditions, including Christianity. The office may also be given as an honorary title to a clergyman who is not the head of a monastery. The female equivalent is abbess.

A court is any person or institution, often as a government institution, with the authority to adjudicate legal disputes between parties and carry out the administration of justice in civil, criminal, and administrative matters in accordance with the rule of law. In both common law and civil law legal systems, courts are the central means for dispute resolution, and it is generally understood that all people have an ability to bring their claims before a court. Similarly, the rights of those accused of a crime include the right to present a defense before a court.
The system of courts that interprets and applies the law is collectively known as the judiciary. The place where a court sits is known as a venue. The room where court proceedings occur is known as a courtroom, and the building as a courthouse; court facilities range from simple and very small facilities in rural communities to large complex facilities in urban communities. 
The practical authority given to the court is known as its jurisdiction (from Latin iūrisdictiō, from iūris, "of the law," + dīcō, "to declare," + -tiō, noun-forming suffix), the court's power to decide certain kinds of questions or petitions put to it. According to William Blackstone's Commentaries on the Laws of England, a court (for civil wrongs) is constituted by a minimum of three parties: the āctor or plaintiff, who complains of an injury done; the reus or defendant, who is called upon to make satisfaction for it; and the jūdex or judicial power, who is to examine the truth of the fact, determine the law arising upon that fact, and, if any injury appears to have been done, ascertain and by its officers apply a legal remedy. It is also usual in the superior courts to have barristers, and attorneys or counsel, as assistants, though, often, courts consist of additional barristers, bailiffs, reporters, and perhaps a jury.
The term "the court" is also used to refer to the presiding officer or officials, usually one or more judges. The judge or panel of judges may also be collectively referred to as "the bench" (in contrast to attorneys and barristers, collectively referred to as "the bar").In the United States, the legal authority of a court to take action is based on personal jurisdiction over the parties to the litigation and subject-matter jurisdiction over the claims asserted.

A judge is a person who presides over court proceedings, either alone or as a part of a panel of judges. A judge hears all the witnesses and any other evidence presented by the barristers or solicitors of the case, assesses the credibility and arguments of the parties, and then issues a ruling in the case based on their interpretation of the law and their own personal judgment. A judge is expected to conduct the trial impartially and, typically, in an open court.
The powers, functions, method of appointment, discipline, and training of judges vary widely across different jurisdictions. In some jurisdictions, the judge's powers may be shared with a jury. In inquisitorial systems of criminal investigation, a judge might also be an examining magistrate. The presiding judge ensures that all court proceedings are lawful and orderly.

AMC Entertainment Holdings, Inc. (d/b/a AMC Theatres, originally an abbreviation for American Multi-Cinema; often referred to simply as AMC and known in some countries as AMC Cinemas or AMC Multi-Cinemas) is an American movie theater chain founded in Kansas City, Missouri and now headquartered in Leawood, Kansas. It is the largest movie theater chain in the world. Founded in 1920, AMC has the largest share of the U.S. theater market ahead of Regal and Cinemark Theatres.After acquiring Odeon Cinemas, UCI Cinemas, and Carmike Cinemas in 2016, it became the largest movie theater chain in the world. It has 2,807 screens in 353 theatres in Europe and 7,755 screens in 593 theatres in the United States.The company is listed on the New York Stock Exchange; from 2012 to 2018, the Chinese conglomerate Wanda Group owned a majority stake in the company. Private equity firm Silver Lake Partners made a $600 million investment in AMC in.
